title: 820-4924: No PP5V_S4
message:
Have this board that  came in with some corrosion damage and wasn't powering. Clean up the corrosion and replaced any corroded components, but still not powering up. What i get is two pulses on PP5V_S4, and even ALL_SYS_PWRGD at initial point of connecting the MagSafe. 

No activity on smc bypass.

PM_BATLOW_L 3.3V
PM_RSMRST_L 3.3V
PM_PWRBTN_L 3.4V
SMC_ONOFF_L 3.4V

Attempted triggering SMC_ONOFF_L while checking PM_PWRBTN_L and PM_PWRBTN_L doesn't change. Remains at 3.4v. 

Any suggestions

title: 820-4924: No PP5V_S4
message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
Clean/remove J6100, if needed.

title: 820-4924: No PP5V_S4
message:
All SPI bus resistors and traces good. 
No change after removing J6100

title: 820-4924: No PP5V_S4
message:
Do you get steady 3V3_S5/SUS?

Check for correct oscillation at Y5110.

title: 820-4924: No PP5V_S4
message: no clock oscillation at Y5110 just DC voltage at pin 1 @ about 1.5v.

title: 820-4924: No PP5V_S4
message: what could cause PM_PWRBTN_L not to respond when SMC_ONOFF_L is triggered? I've replaced the SMC with the same result.

title: 820-4924: No PP5V_S4
message:
SMC controls PM_PWRBTN_L, but it can be blocked by PCH.
1.5V DC could be good at Y5110, but is better to confirm with o-scope in this case.
At least compare with similar good board DC level on both pins of Y5110.

Check power and signals for U5000 (2 OF 2) at page 38.

title: 820-4924: No PP5V_S4
message:
o-scope only showing DC signal. On a good board, it's about 1.35v.

U5000 measurement:
PP1V2_S5_SMC_VDDC - 1.2v
PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC - 3.3
PP3V3_S5_SMC - 3.4
SMC_RESET_L - 3.38
SMC_WAKE_L - 2.9
SMC_CLK32K - 32.77k

title: 820-4924: No PP5V_S4
message:
Y5110 should have 12MHz oscillation.
If not, check its components and traces.
You may need to change SMC.
